definition: cap badge (official sign of rank in Qing dynasty)

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties
court beads (derived from Buddhist prayer beads)
to be bestowed, conferred, or granted by the emperor
(Ming and Qing dynasties) daotai (title for an official responsible for supervising a circuit 道|道[dao4]), aka taotai and circuit intendant
bit (of a bridle)/to hold in the mouth/to harbor (feelings)/to link/to accept/rank/title
tutor to the crown prince (in imperial China)
black hat (worn by feudal official)/fig. official post
